website_summaries.verdict: This emery board multi-pack is a great option for those who like to keep a nail file on hand at all times but may not be the most suitable for thin nails.
pros: Holds up well to frequent use
Each side has a clearly marked rough and medium grit
Especially useful for acrylics, thick nails, toenails, calluses, or strong natural nails
cons: Due to the coarseness, this isn't the best option for weak or brittle nails

customer_reviews.title: These are indeed nail files
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 180/240 grit for my natural nails. I used to use only the cheapo emery boards from the drug store, and would go through about one board per 10 fingers. These are worth the extra cost: I'm still on my first board after 30 fingers, and I guess I can wash them to extend their use? The grit difference is barely noticeable to me, but it's somewhere between the standard red/white emery boards. Does the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great files for a very good price.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these (180-240). I have thin weak nails. They don’t split, but they easily get little nicks and I’m always needing a file to save my sweaters and other knits. These nail files work well on my nails. I don’t have the issue I usually have with files of the edge separating. The two different grit choices are nice. I use the coarser grit when shaping and it makes quick work of taking off length. The finer grit perfectly finishes and smooths. Also, I find the price a very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: kathi c

customer_reviews.title: Probably the only rip off on Amazon Prime......
customer_reviews.text: Sadly.....my Nail Files never arrived. And since it was only $2.19 charged to my Credit Card, just not worth comparing....since everything...and I mean everything else from Amazon...and the Prime Service is soooo friggin outstanding......I could not complain about a lousy $2.19... BUT I am cautious...and will not accidentally order something from MAKARTT again.
customer_reviews.author: TheCatAgain

customer_reviews.title: Very good files. No need to waste money on single/double packs at your local store.
customer_reviews.text: Very good files for everyday use. Price is so much better than purchasing them in single or double packs from local brick and mortar store. I travel frequently and while away from home (and at home) I go to the gym/yoga studio. I like to keep files in my purse and my gym/yoga bags as well as in my vehicles. I only snag my nails when a nail file is nowhere insight so why not keep a file in all of the places where I need them. These files stand up to being tossed into all of my bags, purse and travel back pack.
customer_reviews.author: ConnieColorado

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money but what I received is NOT 180/240 grit. Having used sandpaper for woodworking projects, I just happened to have both 180 and 240 grit to compare the emery boards to. What I received is closer to 80/100 grit. They are VERY coarse. Since I do like them (will be good for the toes) I won't return them but now I have to look for a much finer grit for my entirely too soft, thin fingernails.
customer_reviews.author: R. Latimer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and work very well; tough grit
customer_reviews.text: These seem grittier than most nail files. So they actually work! My wife really likes them. Good value for how many you get. These don’t seem to wear away like the softer nail files. It is hard to tell which side is which grit, which is the only bad thing about it. But you can’t really tell between two honestly. It works well and the rougher grit makes quicker work of filing your nails. I would definitely recommend and buy again once these are worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Milt Drucker

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase this.
customer_reviews.text: The nail file is adequate; it functions properly. However, the seller's persistent emails asking for a glowing review make this an poor choice for a purchase, unless you enjoy being hounded. Their follow-on promotions make this a truly odious purchase experience.
customer_reviews.author: Book Buyer

customer_reviews.title: A Great and Handy Product!
customer_reviews.text: Great and handy product of sturdy construction full utility! It's a little difficult to say too much about emory boards but these are perfect for my needs as they are strong enough to hold up to my rough handling, large enough to be securely held while using them (I hate puny boards and files) and appear to hold up well for many, many uses. I ordered just the coarse (100/180 grit) variety to try them out but will soon be ordering some finer grit 180/240 boards to complement these.
customer_reviews.author: lvschultz2

customer_reviews.title: 180 / 240 For Acrylic Dip Nails - Need to Buy a Different One for Smoothing Out Though
customer_reviews.text: I am using the 180 / 240 for acrylic dip nails. I was unaware of the number rankings for the nail file grit before. I believe 180 was the hardest I had ever owned in the past now that I have used it. The 240 is really strong and coarse for acrylic nails. The 180 is still really strong. I am going to need a separate file with a smaller grit as the second step as both the 240 and 180 leave textured roughness. In the past I guess I had 180 on one side and something much less for the finishing (not a polish, but a smoothing). These are a good value. Rating 5 stars = Love It.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineMM

customer_reviews.title: True Grit
customer_reviews.text: These are some serious nail files. I don't know a lot about nail files but I can tell you these have some course grit. I'm guessing they're a bit harsh for natural nails, although I carefully use them on mine, but for artificial nails they probably remove what you don't want easily and quickly. Not only for nails, I have used one for some light sanding and this worked flawlessly. Great for the workshop where a little rigidity helps.
customer_reviews.author: Tim C.

customer_reviews.title: Not correct grit
customer_reviews.text: No way these are the 180/240 I ordered. Even though it indicates it on the file both sides feel exactly the same and rough. No 240 grit on these. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend. Item last and do their job.
customer_reviews.text: My hands do sweat, the nail files become soft and flimsy. But, it's not the files fault. Although, the material can be washed only twice file do start to fall apart with long uses. Its worth the money. They are comfortable on your hands and not too heavy. They file what's needed. Files do their job and that's what matters. Shipping was super fast!
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Luciano

customer_reviews.title: These were great. I bought them to put in gift bags ...
customer_reviews.text: These were great. I bought them to put in gift bags for Christmas for the girls at my job and I even kept a few for myself. They are the best nail files I have ever used or owned. One side of more rough than the other, but both sides are great. It’s Great for someone with acrylic nails and natural nails
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality nail files!
customer_reviews.text: I have recently had bad luck with nail files where they would be no good after just one use, but these finally turned my luck around. I've used one of the nail files a few times already and I don't just shape my nails, I use files to take them down in length once they've grown out considerably, and it's still working like new. With the quality and quantity in this deal, you will not have to look for more nail files for a while. I am not disappointed and would buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Makartt Professional Nail Files Black
customer_reviews.text: These have different grits, which is good. They run from a grit that will file down the thickest nails to a fine grit that gently smooths out and buffers the nail. Not sure about washable, perhaps a quick rinse but it is better just to tap off any filed nails. By the time you think they may need washing they may be ready for the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Great Files! (Sand the edges tho!)
customer_reviews.text: These work great to shape nails after builder gel has been applied. Just remember to file all of the edges with a metal file or something, so you don't cut your skin when you use the file. I accidentally gave myself a ton of "paper cuts" with the file, and then remembered that I should have sanded the edges first. Once I did that, I've had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: KellyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: New to acrylics, these made shaping SOOOOO much easier. Also, good size, the pack is large enough that I honestly cant see needing more for a long time!! Great value for your money! Make sure you're checking the description to get the correct grit for what you need. I got mine specifically for shaping acrylic, if you are smoothing or using on natural nail, make sure to get a higher number.
customer_reviews.author: Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!! Rough on fingernails
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be good for filing my nails but they are very rough and it actually rips my nails apart and makes them jagged. I do not recommend this product if you want smooth nails.
customer_reviews.author: H20

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This high of grit is ONLY for using on false nails, acrylic, gel polish etc. these are not to use on your natural nail, the grit is too strong it’s just common sense. These are great and do the job just right.
customer_reviews.author: Ebonie M.

customer_reviews.title: I used to be a typical guy
customer_reviews.text: Never bothered to trim my toenails until ... Well, you get the idea. But now I use these files every day or two. I use the 180 side first to get my nails into reasonable shape, and then the 240 side to finish them off and make them gorgeous. The files are a great size for my giant, clumsy meat-hook hands. My feet are so pretty I hardly recognize them!
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great for my nails
customer_reviews.text: I got the 120/240 grain which was perfect. Files and shapes my nails perfectly while leaving a nice finished edge. After using one I immediately made sure I have one of these files with me all the time :)
customer_reviews.author: Holly Crosby

customer_reviews.title: Good natural nail file
customer_reviews.text: This is just the right grit. I wear natural nails now and now they grow so fast! This duo grit is just right to quickly shape and smoothe edges. Lasts longer than paper files. Pack will probably last years, but I can keep them everywhere now. Also marked one to just smooth dogs nails inbetween trims.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Essential hand file for dip manicures!
customer_reviews.text: I got into dip manicures because it is so easy, no chip, not breakage. Amazing! These files are a must! Dip, after practice, requires minimum filing so this is great! These are such good quality files! I definitely did not need so many but now i'm set for life! Also it comes in handy for taking off dip manicures! Versatile, easy to clean, easy to use, and durable!
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: File your worries away
customer_reviews.text: These are the only nail files I use. And they are the best value! If you are a starting to do your own nails at home like me, these are perfect for you. They file so well and shape your nails so well. I've filed away my polygel nails using only this file. I would reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney

customer_reviews.title: Very durable nail files that last a long time.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best nail files I've ever owned. I have one in my purse that I carry for touch-ups "on the road", and after 6 months, I still haven't worn it out. These are wonderfully durable. I rately use the coarse-grit side on my nails, as it is almost too aggressive, but the coarse side is wonderful on foot and hand callouses.
customer_reviews.author: ctsurv553

customer_reviews.title: Durable and good quality for great price
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend needed super course good quality nail files. These were so much cheaper than at our local pharmacy and seem to be really good quality. I like that they don't wear out quickly and that you can rinse them off to keep the nail dust from smoothing them down. Will definitely buy more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a finer grit
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these are nice to have, and I don't regret my purchase. However they are too rough for my tastes. I was looking for something that could take nail off and then polish to smooth finish. The fine grit side doesn't do well smoothing out the nail. The product would've been better if there was greater variation between the two sides, as currently, it feels like there is no difference.
customer_reviews.author: AP Student

customer_reviews.title: Usability
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how anyone can use these fat emery boards. I have tried and tried for years and end up with snarly looking nails. It's not the brand they are all like that to me. I endlessly look for the flat ones that are longer but no one makes them any longer. I end up with ones 41⁄2" long but they will just have to do. At least they don't have Styrofoam stuffed in them.
customer_reviews.author: nonan47

customer_reviews.title: Great for mani/pedi day - humans & pets.
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 rescue pups and in addition to brushing & bathing my furbabies, I also like to keep their nails trim. For the monthly maintainance, I used a dremel-like tool; but for their inbetween grooming these emery boards are great. I use them when doing mani/pedis on my BF & I as well. Great price for someone like myself who might go through them quicker than others.
customer_reviews.author: Minta

customer_reviews.title: Best nail files
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical to purchase these after reading some negative reviews. However, these are by far my favorite nails files. I keep my natural nails short and these files help me to maintain a nice nail shape. I'm sure it'll be a while before I need to repurchase as so many came in the order. I will definitely get these again when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: To thin and weak
customer_reviews.text: I had read the reviews before purchasing but I don’t agree with the good reviews. But that’s me, I tested one for my real nails and I don’t like how flimsy they are. I need something sturdy and nice to file acrylics. I need a precise silhouette for the nails and these files aren’t the best choice. Not worth it
customer_reviews.author: stephanie zepeda

customer_reviews.title: Much better than regular nail files
customer_reviews.text: Really happy to receive these — nails have gotten super long and since the manicurist is no longer available thanks to the pandemic I was getting worried — regular nail file just couldn’t sand down these gel nails — however these did the job nicely — so glad to have gotten them
customer_reviews.author: Ccm989

customer_reviews.title: Quality nail filer
customer_reviews.text: These are good quality nail files, I purchased these because my nails kept cracking on the sides and when I googled ways to reduce breakage and one of the suggestions was to change the type of file I was using. So I tried these files and love them, plus they are washable and they give you a lot in a package. I am constantly using these files for my gel manicures and Pedi's, I will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: 0902virgo

customer_reviews.title: great nail files
customer_reviews.text: These are great nail files. One side is pretty rough for serious take down; the other side is just right for smoothing. I can see where another file with an even finer grit might be handy to have around, but these are perfect for general everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: phoebe bebe

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When I read a review you could use these on smaller dog nails, I jumped at buying these as my rescue dog is so sensitive on his feet. These emory boards are not coarse enough. I will pass them off to someone who wants to smooth their rough edges. My review is strictly for dog nails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good but wish there were a distinguisher b/w sides
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, maybe a little rough on the first use. And a little confusing to tell which side is which, wish they were different colors. But a good file. Use it for my natural nails (240 side mainly)
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these files I ordered them twice I love that they are washable and still are durable after being cleaned with soap and water I bought the 100/180 grit to shape and file acrylic nails they are great I highly recommend these .. and they dont bend
customer_reviews.author: Chasy

customer_reviews.title: Check what product you receive.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 180/240 grit but received the 100/180 grit. I will have to throw these away since they are not usable for fingernails and it is too late to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great for pets
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my dog's nails. If his nails are too short to be trimmed eith a grinder or clippers, to avoid cutting the quick, I use these instead. I am able to sand down quite a bit of his nail in a decent amount of time
customer_reviews.author: J J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Works great. Great quality. Very sturdy. Definitely will buy again in fact I did a week after I got this! Have them everywhere in my house and my office and gave some to friends also great nail file!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Salon quality!! Wow
customer_reviews.text: My only question is, Why did I not buy these before?!! These files are terrific! I have the powder gel nails which can be very thick. These files get you shaped up in just a few minutes! The medium side leaves a smooth pretty finish. They are very much worth the cost. Love that I can keep one at work, in the car, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I've had them over a year. I grab a new one every time an old one is used up. They do exactly what they are supposed to do. I bring them to the nail salon because I don't want them to use whatever tools they have (I think it's gross).
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: I was hoping these would be like the ones I got at my local beauty supply ...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping these would be like the ones I got at my local beauty supply store but they're not. They are smaller than I thought they would be and I don't really think the grit is 100/180 because the two sides feel almost the same. Other than that they seem to be well made but only time will tell how they hold up to being washed and scrubbed.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Quite abrasive on both sides for natural nails!
customer_reviews.text: The files arrived quickly, but I was disappointed in the smoother side. It was still too abrasive for smoothing natural nails.
customer_reviews.author: J5

customer_reviews.title: Excellent nail files
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Very professional and sturdy. I do nails on the side and good nail files are hard to find for a reasonable price but these were much better than I expected. They come all together attached but are easy to remove. Nice and strong and make it easy to file nails without using so much strength.
customer_reviews.author: Mrsc3burke

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Know I Needed Them
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I figured they would be important for clipping my nails better, and they work great. I didn't really realize before exactly what these are for, but now that I have them, I'm thankful for it.
customer_reviews.author: Sej

customer_reviews.title: Way too coarse for my fingernails
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure it's the fault of the nail files or if I just made a bad choice. But regardless of what side I use they shred my fingernails. I'm not getting them again.
customer_reviews.author: Sailor Mon

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and price
customer_reviews.text: I like them because they are made well and has plenty of grit on the boards. Can't say how long they will last because I just received them yesterday. I'm going to use them on my cockatoos nails. These shipped very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried many files before but I think I like this one the most. It is very sturdy and doesn’t get smoothed out fast, allowing you to use it numerous times before bringing out a new one.
customer_reviews.author: K2M3

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I wish these were a little more durable because after 2-3 full sets the file is pretty much worn out but that's way better than some of my other files. These are cheap and I wash them after every use and it hasn't effected them otherwise. They are REALLY rough so I wouldn't use these on natural nails but for my nail enhancements they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought these before and they worked really well but this was my second time buying it and this time I received very dull files, they were barely able to file my natural nail. not sure what happened if they sent me the wrong one or something but its fine makkart normally has good products i dont know why they sent this
customer_reviews.author: angie

customer_reviews.title: Great even for dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have pit bull and her nails grow very fast and hard. We use these to file down her nails to save our hardwood floor. Because her nails are so hard, nail files don't make it through all 4 paws. With these files I was able to file all 4 paws- 2 separate times. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: RL*pedsRN

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product and bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Terrible!!! The adhesive did not keep the sand paper attached to the foam. Customer service emailed me checking on the product and when I reported this no action was completed.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best for nail extensions or natural nail
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Would recommend to anybody who is doing nail extensions polygel or acrylic (i have not tried with gel or other nail extension products. However I'm sure this product would be perfect for all types because of the two grit sizes).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality, what I was hoping for! I recommend these for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I hope for, nice disposable files that last a good while, with heavy use. I not only use them for nails, I'm cintstantly using them for craftwork, sharpening knives, etc. hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: StevenSS

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price for the number of files you get! They work well, better than the ones I've purchased at Ulta actually, and last for a long time. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: wsf

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great item.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing files, sturdy and good price. I used them today to put on a full set, file and shape and they still have a lot of life left on one file!! It’s going to take me awhile to get through the pack!! Amazing. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Izzy

customer_reviews.title: Nice... coarse as wanted and expected
customer_reviews.text: I like these. Though , they as expected are on the coarse side, which i wanted. . i can't tell much difference between the two sides 100/180 they work as expected. haven't had enough experience to comment on washing, will come back later. Good for following after using the clippers.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect touch up for self manicuring
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. Used on arrival, and provided just what I needed. Sturdy and handy to use with ease, evidencing functionality and longevity.
customer_reviews.author: a l brock

customer_reviews.title: File great. Smooth. Clean.
customer_reviews.text: I love these files. One file lasts quite a while before it starts to show signs of wear/use. I wish they came in like a 50pack or 100pack because buying 10 packs of these isn’t cost effective for me right now lol. Best so far. But I love everything by MAKAART.
customer_reviews.author: nicNac Nic

customer_reviews.title: Best for thicker nails!
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best nail filers I've bought. But keep in mind these nail filers are for thick nails, I wouldn't recommend it for thin nails. You might want to try the glass nail filer for thin nails.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Impressively useful, much more 'stout' than expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to sand 3D printed parts and general hobby use. They are extremely impressive for being simple nail file boards. THe 120/240 combo grit is great, and they are thick enough to hold up quite well!
customer_reviews.author: Nightsedge

customer_reviews.title: Very course.  Good for removing rough skin on my heels.
customer_reviews.text: These were really too course. Like course sand paper. So I used them to remove the rough skin on my heels. I hope that this wears them down to where I can use them on my natural nail
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Cooks

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great product but beware of the grit your buying.
customer_reviews.text: The nail file that I got was 100/180 grit i would say that they are really good for thick natural nails or artificial nails. They can also be used to file dog nails really well. I would consider getting a fine grit if your simply getting the nail file for natural nails if they aren’t thick as when you file it does file harsh and could potentially cause bleeding if filing you fast.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: Much too rough for fingernails!...
customer_reviews.text: These are the toughest nail files I’ve ever had. They’re good for woodworking in tight corners but not meant to touch anyone’s fingernails!
customer_reviews.author: Quality Lady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and value
customer_reviews.text: the quality of these surprised me. They hold up even with heavy use, and having dual grit is super convenient. They rinse off easily and are like new again.
customer_reviews.author: KNM

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fast
customer_reviews.text: These are very good. Long lasting, easy to clean, and a different grit on each side. One side for toenails, the other for fingernails. It does not take long to file down the toughest roughest toenail.
customer_reviews.author: Tertullus

customer_reviews.title: All the same coarseness, no matter what grit you choose
customer_reviews.text: This is my third order, starting with 240/180 and moving down in grit from there. All of them are exactly the same coarseness. I cannot use any of them.
customer_reviews.author: liketoshop

customer_reviews.title: Must have files
customer_reviews.text: Perfect and eco friendly. If you have bought files that gave out on you fast, buy these instead. They are water proof and the grit is just right. They are double sided. Great buy over disposables!
customer_reviews.author: Anglyn Hays

customer_reviews.title: Safer than clippers
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a lot of feeling in my feel so I have to be very careful when cutting my toenails. I got these as I've decided to file them instead of cutting them with sizzers or clippers. Did them this morning and was very impressed with results that were so smooth. And no blood! AND it took about the same amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: HODGEPODGESPVTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Too coarse
customer_reviews.text: Ripped my nails to shreds. Too coarse for human use.
customer_reviews.author: W. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Good for artificial nails
customer_reviews.text: Good coarse grade...perfect for artificial/tip nails. Good size, works well. Probably too coarse for natural nails. These were exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged, fast shipping, reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.text: There's not a lot to say about a product like this, especially if there's no Cons to notify other customers about. It does a great job on my hands, nails, and rough spots. No irritation.
customer_reviews.author: sci f.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely coarse on both sides
customer_reviews.text: This may be well-made but they are incredibly rough, maybe good for your pet Wolverines nails. Can’t imagine using these on nails Except if they are very long and you wanna make them shorter quickly
customer_reviews.author: 30 Weight

customer_reviews.title: Quality for gel nails!
customer_reviews.text: Nail files are good quality and do not peel away like others when used on gel nails. Really like the color easy to see if they are over used.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: This product is very long lasting and it washes beautifully.
customer_reviews.text: I had a fungus in one big toe, and using this and filing my nail in a downward direction healed the fungus. I will keep on using it because its easier than clipping my nails.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: They did the job
customer_reviews.text: They are 100/180 grit. They came tightly wrapped in a set of 10. They do tend to bend after some use but that's normal. They worked really well to shape plastic tips and shaping acrylic. They do wear down after so many uses obviously but I'd have to say over all I was happy with my purchase and they did what I bought them for.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Davis

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Received the nail files. They seem to “drop” black file pieces all over and have lifted edges, and spots missing any coating at all. Would not order again unfortunately
customer_reviews.author: Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Files
customer_reviews.text: The quality is there, but I will never use that many files in my life time. Smaller packages would have been better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Reints

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Works well to file smooth my acrylic nails. Update: These are better than expected. Will last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: Yellow Earrings

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice files at a good price. I have enough to leave one in every area of my home I might need one, plus in the car and at work. Very helpful for when I have a hang nail or break a nail and need to remove it quickly to prevent chewing on my nails.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Great for dip powder nails
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these! I was looking for good files for shaping my nails after the dip powder and these worked perfect. Very durable, I’m happy I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: Chelseybelle

customer_reviews.title: 180/240 GREAT FOR MY NATURAL NAILS
customer_reviews.text: Loved these files. They are great for natural brittle nails. You get a value buying this set vs your local Wally world or Walgreens. Walgreens charges $8 for a set of 3 ( no ma'am)! I definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: KIMA J

customer_reviews.title: Listed as 180 - 240 grit, I use a ...
customer_reviews.text: Listed as 180 - 240 grit, I use a lot of different grit abrasives and my main ones are 240 grit and these seem a bit rougher than the advertised grit. Seller is sending a sample of another brand that is 240 grit for me to test. Thanks, :)
customer_reviews.author: Phantom II

customer_reviews.title: Very well made but a little course for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: I got these and were impressed with the quality and value but they were a little course. I subsequently replaced them with 180/240 grit and the new ones are exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: alfisch

customer_reviews.title: One side is great for natural nails and the other is perfect for ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted and for some reason difficult to find. These are the thick, study files. One side is great for natural nails and the other is perfect for gel, on the few occasions a year I get them. Shipping was great as usual, with Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 240/180 for filing my natural nails and these are better than anything I've ever used, the board itself was strong and wasn't bening when I would use pressuure to file. Most emery boards I purchased from drugstores will bend in the middle right away. I'm happy with these and plan on getting more in the future
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Can't answer to longevity since I've only had the files for a couple of days but they met expectations and do a good job.
customer_reviews.author: In Elvis Land

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Same as used in the salon and enough of them that I don't have to constantly replace purchase. Good quality and value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased, would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with these nail files. I would highly recommend them. I cannot speak to their longevity as I only received them a few weeks ago. But they are the best nail files I have ever bought. So glad I found them!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting nail files
customer_reviews.text: I use them at home after clipping my nails, and one board lasts like six months, it's hard to wear them out. Good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Michael V. Raffety

customer_reviews.title: Gourd sander
customer_reviews.text: I like to craft and I am presently engaged in a project to lamps or level ears out of gourds. In fine-tuning the outside skin of my current project, I used the file to help remove the black mold that was sticking to it. My only problem with the files is that they don't last long enough. I am ordering another set to use with my sanding project.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Not so good. They don't last very long and fall apart easily. Not a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Doxiechon

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, works like the should. They seem to be better quality than Walmart. Were have reorderd.
customer_reviews.author: William Burton

customer_reviews.title: They are too thick for my use.
customer_reviews.text: I don't like them because of their wideness. Hard to get between fingernail and skin. I'm back to order the regular type of nail file.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely wonderful! I use the 180 before flipping them to the 240. Finally, a 600 file followed by some buffing with the other side results in wonderful, beautiful nails!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: These are not only useful for humans but also for dogs. My dog won't let me cut his hails but will let me file them. Tried an electric file but that didn't work either. Using files for artificial nails was my best solution.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heckel

customer_reviews.title: Good nail files.
customer_reviews.text: Great nail files. For someone who has bitten their fingernails for 39 years and recently stopped, these are a must for keeping my nails short as possible. Love the 2 different grits so I can really get after it and then smooth things over.
customer_reviews.author: Corbinwaterski

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for guitar pickers
customer_reviews.text: These work GREAT to get the nails how U want them to begin the process of learning finger guitar picking
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to buff my nails before applying gel or stick on nails they’re great! Also work well for shaping the stick on nails.
customer_reviews.author: Jeimy

product_meta.title: MAKARTT Nail Files 100 180 Grit for Poly Nail Extension Gel Acrylic Nails Files Double Sided Black Washable 10 Nail File Set Manicure Tools F-01
feature_bullets: ★★★Excellent Nail Filing Tools- Makartt black nail files work quickly to trim or shape the acrylic nail with your desired shape or length. They are also perfect to remove poly extension gel or fake nails, and suitable for Pet Grooming!

★★★Different Grits Function Differently- Makartt nail file set is ideal to file and rough up the hard fingernails and toe nails in 100 grit, while 180 grit smoothes up your nail edge with refined shape.

★★★Premium Quality Materials- Makartt 100/180 Nail Files are made with top quality adhesive tape and emery board materials. Designed with round top & Double Sides, these nice, sturdy & durable nail files provides you a comfortable nail doing experience. You only just need to apply light pressure but can see results immediately and they will not bend!

★★★Must Have in Nail Salons and Home- The Lima de uñas are great for all your filing needs, Nails, Hobbies, Crafts. Must have in professional salons and diy nail art at home. A terrific gift for girls who love nail art as Valentine's Day gift, Birthday gift, Christmas gift & Halloween gift.
★★★Washable Nail Files- Makartt emery boards can be washed with water, quick & easy to clean.
